isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 1.2: INJECTION CONTROL PRESSURE SYSTEM - INJECTION CONTROL SYSTEM OPERATION - INJECTION PRESSURE CONTROL

svcproc.title: INJECTION PRESSURE CONTROL
svcproc.para:
The ECM controls the injection control pressure by operating the Injection Control Pressure Regulator (IPR) Figure 1.6
. The result of this control is continuously monitored by the ECM using the Injection Control Pressure Sensor (ICP). The pressure signal obtained from the ICP allows the ECM to know the actual injection control pressure at all times of engine operation or even during cranking mode. This operation is known as "Closed Loop" Figure 1.7
.

Diagnostic codes can be set by the ECM if the ICP electrical signal is out of range or if the ICP signal received corresponds to an out of range value for the injection control pressure at a given operating condition.
Should any of these occur, the ECM will ignore the ICP signal and control the IPR valve operation from preprogrammed default values. This condition is known as 'Open Loop"
